result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Lance Drier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs waived due to ability to pay.  Fine/County Appointed Attorney Fees to paid in installments of $50.00 per month commencing 12-05-2016 and the 5th of each month thereafter until paid in full.

DNA surcharge waived due to ability to pay.
Pay County Appointed Attorney Fees TBD.
AMENDED 11-07-2016:  County Appointed Attorney Fees Ordered $479.50.

records.addlTxt: 17R 000322.  Balance owing in payment plan paid in full

Order for Compensation of Court Appointed Atty.  Ordered that $479.50 be allowed to said atty as compensation of his professional service and disbursements, said sums to be paid to said Atty. by Pepin County and Pepin County shall be reimbursed by defendant as previously ordered.
records.descr: Order for reimbursement of GAL or Attorney

records.addlTxt: Petition for Payment of County Appointed Attorney Fees $479.50.

Defendant Craig Lance Drier in court with attorney Allan L Morgan.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached, defendant will plead to charge, fine/costs and defendant requests court waive costs due to ability to pay.  Court advises defendant of charge/ max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest.  PLQ/WOR form filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant of his constitutional rights; finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.  Court sentences defendant to $250 fine, waive costs based on ability to pay; pay County Appt'd Atty Fees TBD; TTP $50/mo. com. 12/5; defendant to complete TTP.  Advised of appeal rights.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Adjourned initial appearance on October 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 18, 2016 at 11:30 am.
NOH & Order Appointing Defense Atty mailed to Craig Lance Drier ret'd to sender, no such number, unable to forward.  (remailed to address provided on 9/12/16)

Ordered that Attorney Allan Morgan is appointed to represent the defendant as defense counsel.
Further Ordered That the defendant shall reimburse the County by monthly installments of $50.00 per month commencing 10-10-2016, subsequent payments due the same day of each and every month thereafter.
Failure to make scheduled payments without a showing by the defendant of good cause shall be contempt of court punishable under Ch. 785, Wis. Stats. and the Court shall do any of the following:  See Order

Defendant Craig Lance Drier in court with attorney Gary E. Smith.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant informs didn't qualify for SPD, on disability.  Court appoints Atty Allan Morgan.  Defendant to reimburse Pepin County at rate of $50/mo. com. 10/10/16.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
